channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MCHECKSTYLE-225] headerLocation no longer sets checkstyle.header.file
item.project: Maven Checkstyle Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
We use a multi-module configuration as described at https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/examples/multi-module-config.html

This morning I tried upgraded to checkstyle-plugin 2.12 and our builds started failing with:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.12:check (default-cli) on project common: Failed during checkstyle execution: Failed during checkstyle configuration: unable to read /path/to/common/target/checkstyle-checker.xml - unable to parse configuration stream - Property ${checkstyle.header.file} has not been set -> [Help 1]

Our config hasn't changed in almost two years. We are currently using v2.11 so this seems like a regression in 2.12
item.environment: JDK 7u51 on OS X with Maven 3.1.0

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The plugin config looks like:

        <plugin>
          <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
          <artifactId>maven-checkstyle-plugin</artifactId>
          <version>${checkstyle.version}</version>
          <dependencies>
            <dependency>
              <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
              <artifactId>build-tools</artifactId>
              <version>${project.version}</version>
            </dependency>
          </dependencies>
          <configuration>
            <excludes>**/package-info.java</excludes>
            <configLocation>maginatics/checkstyle.xml</configLocation>
            <headerLocation>maginatics/copyright_header.txt</headerLocation>
            <suppressionsLocation>maginatics/checkstyle-suppressions.xml</suppressionsLocation>
            <propertyExpansion>config_loc=/maginatics</propertyExpansion>
            <includeTestSourceDirectory>true</includeTestSourceDirectory>
            <violationSeverity>warning</violationSeverity>
          </configuration>
        </plugin>

I've also encountered this problem. Plugin configuration is as follows:

                <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-checkstyle-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>2.12</version>
                    <executions>
                        <execution>
                            <phase>process-sources</phase>
                            <goals>
                                <goal>check</goal>
                            </goals>
                        </execution>
                    </executions>
                    <dependencies>
                        <dependency>
                            <groupId>com.offbynull.peernetic</groupId>
                            <artifactId>build-tools</artifactId>
                            <version>${project.version}</version>
                        </dependency>
                    </dependencies>
                    <configuration>
                        <consoleOutput>true</consoleOutput>
                        <configLocation>build-tools/checkstyle.xml</configLocation>
                        <headerLocation>build-tools/LICENSE.txt</headerLocation>
                    </configuration>
                </plugin>
It seems that this was caused by the fix for MCHECKSTYLE-219.

Having looked at it, I think that the implementation of the new LicenseResourceManager is wrong. Lines 60-66:

            if ( resourceLoader instanceof ThreadContextClasspathResourceLoader
                && !"config/maven-header.txt".equals( name ) )
            {
                // MCHECKSTYLE-219: Don't load the license from the plugin
                // classloader, only allow config/maven-header.txt
                continue;
            }

Shouldn't it be:

            if ( resourceLoader instanceof ThreadContextClasspathResourceLoader
                && "config/maven-header.txt".equals( name ) )
            {
                // MCHECKSTYLE-219: Don't load the license from the plugin
                // classloader, only allow config/maven-header.txt
                continue;
            }

Robert, could you comment on that?
I have added an IT that fails with trunk version, but that works with 2.11.

dennislundberg, the piece of code is a bit too small to see what's happening here. The LicenseResourceManager has several ResourceLoader, such as jar, file and this one. It will loop over these resourceLoaders until in has found the resource. MCHECKSTYLE-219 shows that files from the maven-checkstyle-plugin can leak. There's only one file which is allowed to be pulled from the plugin, and that is the config/maven-header.txt. The next line after the if-statement (but within the for-loop) tries to find the resource.
MCHECKSTYLE-225 shows there's another way to refer to a license, for which no integration-test was written yet. This is an additional jar, which is added as dependency so it ends up on the classpath. Right now there's a discussion about immutable classpaths on the dev-list and this is a nice example. The license-jar is just an additional jar and has nothing to do with the classpath of the plugin. It could be any file, as long as the checkstyle-plugin knows how to pick it up. We're working on a proposal for this, but it requires a modification in the pom.xml.
For now we need to restore the ability to add a license by dependency, without searching through the original dependencies of the plugin. I think I've found a solution, but need to write some more tests to confirm that only the additional jars are read.
Fixed in r1586844
FYI I see the exact same error and failure with checkstyle 2.12.1

It would have nice if you had tested this once it was marked as resolved. Also, dennislundberg has added an integration-test which should reflect your usecase: http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/maven/plugins/trunk/maven-checkstyle-plugin/src/it/MCHECKSTYLE-225-customHeader/
I'm wondering what's the difference.
rfsholte apologies; I did get the email updates but verifying the fix wasn't on top of my priority list. I will check the integration test and update.

OK so one difference in my setup is that the checkstyle config is specified in the top-level pom (via pluginManagement) instead of the submodule pom (e.g. in the integration test instead of in core/pom.xml it should have been in top-level pom.xml).

Diwaker,

Please supply us with a complete project that we can use to test this. Without that we are simply guessing as to what might be the cause of your issues. We can the use that project and turn it into an integration test to make sure this doesn't break again.
confirmed that it still doesn't work when using pluginManagement
pluginManagement usage fixed in r1589845, please verify.
Confirmed that latest fix works. Thanks Robert! Look forward to the 2.13 release!!

jira-importer commented on issue #541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/541#issuecomment-2969791914

**[Diwaker Gupta](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=diwakergupta)** commented

The plugin config looks like:

```
<plugin>
<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
<artifactId>maven-checkstyle-plugin</artifactId>
<version>${checkstyle.version}</version>
<dependencies>
<dependency>
<groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
<artifactId>build-tools</artifactId>
<version>${project.version}</version>
</dependency>
</dependencies>
<configuration>
<excludes>**/package-info.java</excludes>
<configLocation>maginatics/checkstyle.xml</configLocation>
<headerLocation>maginatics/copyright_header.txt</headerLocation>
<suppressionsLocation>maginatics/checkstyle-suppressions.xml</suppressionsLocation>
<propertyExpansion>config_loc=/maginatics</propertyExpansion>
<includeTestSourceDirectory>true</includeTestSourceDirectory>
<violationSeverity>warning</violationSeverity>
</configuration>
</plugin>
```

jira-importer opened a new issue, #541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/541

**[Diwaker Gupta](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=diwakergupta)** opened **MCHECKSTYLE-225(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-225?redirect=false)** and commented

We use a multi-module configuration as described at https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/examples/multi-module-config.html

This morning I tried upgraded to checkstyle-plugin 2.12 and our builds started failing with:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.12:check (default-cli) on project common: Failed during checkstyle execution: Failed during checkstyle configuration: unable to read /path/to/common/target/checkstyle-checker.xml - unable to parse configuration stream - Property ${checkstyle.header.file} has not been set -> [Help 1]
```

Our config hasn't changed in almost two years. We are currently using v2.11 so this seems like a regression in 2.12

—

*Affects:* 2.12

*Issue Links:*

  • MCHECKSTYLE-250(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-250) NPE on tying to load LICENSE.txt resource from non-jar plugin dependencies
  • MCHECKSTYLE-219(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-219) When no license is specified, ALv2 from maven-checkstyle-plugin is used

*Backported to:* [2.12.1](https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/milestone/18?closed=1)

3 votes, 6 watchers

**[offbynull](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=offbynull)** commented

I've also encountered this problem. Plugin configuration is as follows:

```
<plugin>
<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
<artifactId>maven-checkstyle-plugin</artifactId>
<version>2.12</version>
<executions>
<execution>
<phase>process-sources</phase>
<goals>
<goal>check</goal>
</goals>
</execution>
</executions>
<dependencies>
<dependency>
<groupId>com.offbynull.peernetic</groupId>
<artifactId>build-tools</artifactId>
<version>${project.version}</version>
</dependency>
</dependencies>
<configuration>
<consoleOutput>true</consoleOutput>
<configLocation>build-tools/checkstyle.xml</configLocation>
<headerLocation>build-tools/LICENSE.txt</headerLocation>
</configuration>
</plugin>
```

jira-importer commented on issue #541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/541#issuecomment-2969791930

**[Dennis Lundberg](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dennisl@apache.org)** commented

It seems that this was caused by the fix for MCHECKSTYLE-219.

jira-importer commented on issue #541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/541#issuecomment-2969791934

**[Dennis Lundberg](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dennisl@apache.org)** commented

Having looked at it, I think that the implementation of the new LicenseResourceManager is wrong. Lines 60-66:

```java
if ( resourceLoader instanceof ThreadContextClasspathResourceLoader
&& !"config/maven-header.txt".equals( name ) )

{ // MCHECKSTYLE-219: Don't load the license from the plugin // classloader, only allow config/maven-header.txt continue; }

```

Shouldn't it be:

```java
if ( resourceLoader instanceof ThreadContextClasspathResourceLoader
&& "config/maven-header.txt".equals( name ) )

{ // MCHECKSTYLE-219: Don't load the license from the plugin // classloader, only allow config/maven-header.txt continue; }

```

Robert, could you comment on that?

jira-importer commented on issue #541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/541#issuecomment-2969791951

**[Robert Scholte](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=rfscholte)** commented

[dennislundberg](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dennislundberg), the piece of code is a bit too small to see what's happening here. The `LicenseResourceManager` has several ResourceLoader, such as jar, file and this one. It will loop over these resourceLoaders until in has found the resource. MCHECKSTYLE-219 shows that files from the maven-checkstyle-plugin can leak. There's only one file which is allowed to be pulled from the plugin, and that is the `config/maven-header.txt`. The next line after the if-statement (but within the for-loop) tries to find the resource.
MCHECKSTYLE-225 shows there's another way to refer to a license, for which no integration-test was written yet. This is an additional jar, which is added as dependency so it ends up on the classpath. Right now there's a discussion about immutable classpaths on the dev-list and this is a nice example. The license-jar is just an additional jar and has nothing to do with the classpath of the plugin. It could be any file, as long as the checkstyle-plugin knows how to pick it up. We're working on a proposal for this, but it requires a modification in the pom.xml.
For now we need to restore the ability to add a license by dependency, without searching through the original dependencies of the plugin. I think I've found a solution, but need to write some more tests to confirm that only the additional jars are read.
